Review.Titre: Rude customer service
Review.Contenu: I tried to get a postal form notarized for mail forwarding. There were multiple steps to verify my identity, including questions and pictures of documents (without an option to upload files I had). I eventually made it through to a person, who was very unfriendly, made me take pictures again, and finally informed me that the IDs did not match, and canceled the session. He suggested to try again - which would have required going through the entire process again. What a complete waste of time!

Review.Titre: Where the hell are my documents
Review.Contenu: Where the hell are my documents, and why were they never forwarded to me and our pmb?   We’re just finding this out now.

Review.Titre: Dont use this services they ll sell your personal information from the verificationprocess!
Review.Contenu: I want you to immediately remove all my personal data you have stored ! As well you  sold my persobal information  to 9 diffrent including ussearch.comInstatcheckmate.comPublicrecords.comIntelius.comAnywho.comZabasearch.comAddresses.comTruthfinder.comYellowpages.com. If you file here you can find your info exposed to all the hackers to easily create a profile about you!

Review.Titre: Rude and Unprofessional Notary
Review.Contenu: This was the first time I've notorized a document online. The notary came online and was instantly rude and annoyed at me. No hello or hi. Nothing. I tried asking simple questions about what I needed to fill out and he actually became angry with me and lectured me on what a notary's job was and wasn't. He ended the call by simply hanging up on me. Literally, he just hung up after notarizing my document. It was a terrible experience. I would never recommend getting notorized online. A complete lack of professional. I literally want my money back.

Review.Titre: Trying to get my Form 1583 Notarized…
Review.Contenu: Trying to get my Form 1583 Notarized required by iPostal.com and I need it done online to ship internationally yet the questions are answered correctly but it would still fail you. I have been on this for days because it locks you out for 24hours. Zero stars if possible as no one can help yet I have one company already verified but they won’t use that for my other companies.

Review.Titre: I am required to get my Form 1583…
Review.Contenu: I am required to get my Form 1583 Notarized by iPostal.com and the only notary they use to get this done from Notarize, where Notarize's Proof.com has a document scanning system that does not recognise international documents in my case Indian Passport. And the worst part is that customer support has no answers and no resolution, the only thing they say is to keep trying, and we cannot help you. I tried for 4 days but yet nothing worked and I gave up.

Review.Titre: Tried numerous times to get documents…
Review.Contenu: Tried numerous times to get documents processed, but there was always some sort of technical issue.  I'm on a T1 fiber line with more than enough bandwidth.  Twice, a notary came on camera and then quickly covered his camera and didn't reply to chat messages.  This is probably the worst online service I've run into in quite some time.

Review.Titre: I literally spent days trying to figure…
Review.Contenu: I literally spent days trying to figure out how to use this app. Granted, my knowledge of computers is limited however that would tell me that simpler instructions were needed. Even after reaching out i was again instructed  to go to yet another site!!

Review.Titre: Need to accommodations people with hearing impaired.
Review.Contenu: I am hard-of-hearing and cannot hear of what the person is saying. He kept asking the same question over and over again when I told him I don’t understand. He is somewhat patient but have the audacity to say ‘please listen to me’ multiple times. Which that is harder even after I cannot hear. I believe it should have captions when the person is speaking or types/write in order to accommodate people with hearing impaired.

Review.Titre: three things notorized wrong
Review.Contenu: We had three things notorized. The notary changed our state and county at top of the acknowledgement page to their state and county. This made the notarization invalid and our county clerk would not accept it. I also verified with the NNA that this was done incorrectly. We asked for a refund and were to told no. This was their last response to us."I appreciate the response. We always strive to leave our customers 100% satisfied. I realize that may not have been the case for you this time around. We continually strive to improve and would appreciate any additional feedback. We look forward to better serving you next time at Proof.Take care,Antwanette

Review.Titre: System is terrible & takes forever
Review.Contenu: Was extremely difficult to establish my identity.  Regardless how many times I gave "access" to my camera on my phone (iphone 13 pro), it wouldn't work.  I rebooted my phone, tried both Google and Safari browsers.... finally after over an hour of attempting it finally worked.  We used the remote notary as a convenience, it turns out it would have been more convenient and quicker to go to a bank or UPS store and have it done!  Will NEVER use this service again.

Review.Titre: Avoid at all costs.
Review.Contenu: Your five multiple choice questions had multiple correct answers. Resulted in a correct answer chosen but ultimately scored incorrect. Resulted in being locked out. Notary identification requirements are not standardized across states. Resulted in a moving target to have the correct identification to begin the process. We ended up with notaries from Texas when we live in Minnesota. Best to avoid this service if at all possible and find a local notary to take care of your needs. This is what we did after struggling to get through the online process.

Review.Titre: I purchased the business/residential…
Review.Contenu: I purchased the business/residential address package and wanted to include my adult kid as well. Having them also do the 1583 doc to notarize is fine and makes sense however iPostal1 and Notarize run seamless and speak to each other. The Notarize agent had no clue each person in the household over 21 needs to fill this out per IPostal1. Agent kept advising paper didn’t need to be signed at all and yet IPostal1 said 💯 yes. This made our process and all the proof just insane to deal with. One hand doesn’t talk to the other!

Review.Titre: DO NOT USE THIS SERVICE!!!
Review.Contenu: DO NOT USE THIS SERVICE!!!Most city and local county office does not accept digital type notary. Notarize.com do not offer refunds. I did not see any disclosures regarding this on their website. Went to UPS Store for the notary. It was quicker and cheaper.

Review.Titre: Nightmare!
Review.Contenu: Notary assigned to us refused to go through transaction because wife’s drivers license only has one of her two parts of hyphenated last name even though we had marriage license in hand to show entire name. Have closed on at least a few dozen real estate & notary transactions using same name/license over past 10+ years without ever a problem. Went and closed in person at title office down the road about 2 hours later  - again no problem using same info. This notary could have cost us millions by holding up our sale. Will never use this service again.

Review.Titre: Notaries give bad advice, no refund
Review.Contenu: Needed a power of attorney notarized. It included a place for two witnesses signing. On the call, I explained to the notary why I needed the PoA. She said "it’s asking for witnesses. I can cross those out, you don’t necessarily need witnesses, it’s up to you". Trusting her expertise, I said ok. Turns out, I did need the two witnesses. Notarize customer service said since she "gave me a choice" they would not refund. I said if she hadn't said "you don't necessarily need witnesses" I would not have forgone them. Terrible advice and service and now I've missed an important deadline.

Review.Titre: Incredibly difficult to use
Review.Contenu: Incredibly difficult to use. And time consuming. Took me a half hour to get through all their silly questionnaires and the video conferencing didn't work. It works with everybody else but not with your company. I have a live notary just a mile away and it takes me a lot less time to go there and it is much more efficient. I will never use your company again. And the live notary is less expensive. I paid a premium for inferior service.

Review.Titre: Software is Weak
Review.Contenu: Software is bad. Tried to show my DL with my high quality Logitech camera and it wouldn't capture the image without blurring. So shifted to the camera on my phone and that worked but it took about 20 minutes (with live assistance) to figure out that my Logitech camera wouldn't work properly for this task.

Review.Titre: Not accepted by the US passport office
Review.Contenu: The notarized documents from notarize.com were NOT accepted by the US passport office. We had to resubmit documents notarized by an in-person notary, and the total process took an additional 6 weeks at least.

Review.Titre: We had connection issues
Review.Contenu: We had connection issues, the staff kept hanging up. I fixed the problem by moving closer to the router. Mexico has poor internet connection. Another person did not know what a Canadian land title document meant. I explained to her - it's a deed. She continued to argue its meaning and hung up on me! THIS IS NOT PROFESSIONAL

Review.Titre: Made us waste a day and never worked
Review.Contenu: The website never let us take pictures of our id so we couldn’t move forward. The app gave a message that said transaction not supported on the notarize app. We wasted a day trying and even support couldn’t help.  We ended up having to see a live person anyway the next day.

Review.Titre: Very poor explained process
Review.Contenu: Very poor explained process. Customer service is terrible, they did not know how to solve the error I had, they had no idea . After more than a month of trying to get through the process I finally figured out by myself what was wrong. The notary however was nice

Review.Titre: Nothing but glitches throughout the…
Review.Contenu: Nothing but glitches throughout the process. Tried 4 different devices (Apple and Android: phones, tablets and laptops). Caused us to close late on our house. If there were negative stars that's what I would have left in the review.

Review.Titre: I had to complete the forms 6 times…
Review.Contenu: I had to complete the forms 6 times since ID upload would not complete.  When I finalized upload and was transferred to notory agent, after initial question, their connection terminated.  This prompted me to re-log in to complete the process yet again.  After completion, the agent would not connect,; I later found out this because my signing had to be reassigned to another agent.  Had to complete process again.The concept is convenient, not having to go into title company, but the process needs work.

Review.Titre: Does not work "anywhere" without some tweaking
Review.Contenu: Their website says anywhere, anytime, but after going halfway through the process they told us we need a US residential address.We tried again and used a US address from 12 years ago. The verification went through and we got a helpful notary.Dear Notary.com: on the verification page you should ask for "present or most recent US address."

Review.Titre: Find a cheaper notary service
Review.Contenu: Please note, they charge $25 for notary services you can easily go get for free in your neighborhood or for a couple dollars. I had a horrible experience with them where I got a document motorized for services that were cancelled immediately for the wrong address and they wanted to charge another $25 to notarize the new document. Unless you live in a remote area, do it the old fashion way.

Review.Titre: My Power Of Attorney is not accepted in…
Review.Contenu: My Power Of Attorney is not accepted in a title office in New York. Time and money wasted…When I asked for a refund, they told me they can’t do it..Very disappointed. Timing was  crucial in my situation. I lost at least 3 days of it

Review.Titre: I had the misfortune of dealing with a…
Review.Contenu: I had the misfortune of dealing with a really unhelpful guy called Mohammed.He didn't seem to understand the document he was reading to me and wasn't capable or willing to find any solution. It seemed like he was just trying to get me off the call as fast as possible rather than offering the minimum level of help, really disappointing

Review.Titre: US passport: valid ID?
Review.Contenu: She would not accept my US passport as valid ID; insisted I retake pictures of my Texas drivers license under the pretense, “In Texas you cannot use a passport as ID.” I am unsure of the validity of this, but the hyperlink provided for accepted forms of ID included passport. Also, was very robot and monotone.

Review.Titre: I was unable to use document
Review.Contenu: There was a piece of information that was filled out incorrectly - the state and county at the top left. I had written the state and county that I was going to be turning the documents into. However, apparently, it should have been the state and county the documents were notarized in. I just feel that the notary should have known that as that's not exactly commonly known information in my opinion. I wasted $55 using y'all just to get documents I couldn't use and had to re-notarize it.

Review.Titre: Horrible customer service
Review.Contenu: Horrible customer service, will never use again.  This was my first time using the service, document had lines missing the person on the video call never advised to fill them prior to notarizing.  So the document is useless to me now.  Asked to do it over or refund , and was refused.   Usually when you see notary in person they advise you, where to initial ,  and sign.  These guys don’t care just quickly stamp and move on.  Hard refusal to redo or refund was upsetting.  Will never use again.

Review.Titre: Terrible
Review.Contenu: Terrible. Nothing works. Every single touch point failed upon using this service. Wasted 5 hrs of my day. Finally got connected and the notary disconnected the call. No follow up and they expect you to start the process again. Don’t believe the reviews. This service is terrible.

Review.Titre: Will never intentionally use their service again
Review.Contenu: I attempted to have a document notarized 8 times. I was given conflicting information. I was hung up on by the same Notary twice and all they could do was take my complaint. I'm assuming all of the notaries are privately contracted and are not required to be professional. I was also told I couldn't be directly connected to Notary that could handle my situation and after hours of searching I found one on my own.

Review.Titre: This website does not accurately…Don't use this site if you actually need a New York Notary
Review.Contenu: This website does not accurately advertise its services. I used this website because it says it's a 24/7 notary serving the people of new york. Following my services I found out I was paired with a Florida notary. I complained to customer service and asked for a refund and they refused. I told them it's absolutely ridiculous to have a website that advertises serving the people of new york and have no new york notaries.

Review.Titre: Identity theft fraud after notarize.com
Review.Contenu: I worked with a notary based in Florida this morning to get my identity confirmed for a PO Box. This afternoon I had several applications to loans attempted in my name (based out of Florida - go figure). Thankfully I think all were denied. Do not work with this company. I was directed to them by ipostal1.com, which will be my next company to review (and they didn't care at all and were quite rude). Seriously, if you can use a real, in-person notary then please do so you don't risk identity theft like has happened to me.

Review.Titre: i did EVERYTHING asked talked to your…
Review.Contenu: i did EVERYTHING asked talked to your notary paid and everything was perfect then , few hours later I get a couple of MORE emails to do it ALL again so you are either trying to scam me or someone from your end is sleeping on the job ! Adding insult to injury nobody is answering my emails or even attempting to explain why this is happening and why you're asking me to pay and do it over again !!!!!!

Review.Titre: I was unable to use the system due to…
Review.Contenu: I was unable to use the system due to the security questions. Some of the questions were pulled from excessively old facts I simply could not remember. No options to skip questions you don’t know.  Disappointing.

Review.Titre: The notary who assisted was not helpful…
Review.Contenu: The notary who assisted was not helpful at all. My experience with Notarize.com has not been positive. I am now being asked to provide additional ID's for other team members when the notary rep could have told me that would be a requirement, just to set up a virtual mailbox. A great deal of wasted time.

Review.Titre: We were supposed to have both my…
Review.Contenu: We were supposed to have both my husband and I sign and our information validated and mine was requested twice and then the notary said that was because he had to call in on his own but that was not correct.  Then it seemed she was new and didn’t really know what was supposed to get done.

Review.Titre: Not recommended.
Review.Contenu: Each Notary has different rules about how to do this. Took three tries to get one page notarized. The first notary inserted today's date for their license expiration date. The second notary put next year for "today's date!"  If you have to make sure the notary knows what year it is, there is a problem. I would not recommend this service at all.

Review.Titre: I wound up spending 45 on documents I…
Review.Contenu: I wound up spending 45 on documents I didn’t need notarized and not getting the documents I needed notarized. The process was confusing and notary notarized the 3 forms of ID instead of the document. No refund, no allowing me to do the one document for free. Wasn’t fair.

Review.Titre: Terrible Experience
Review.Contenu: If I could give it a zero, I would.  Multiple attempts to try to get a document notarized, then Notarize wants you to change your browser, same problem occurs, and they charge you $25 for every attempt.  So I was charged $100 and still didn’t get form notarized.I do NOT recommend.

Review.Titre: Terrible service
Review.Contenu: Terrible service. I was referred to use notarize from Transamerica to roll over a 401k to my IRA. I used the Transamerica link to Notarize but the notary uploaded my signed document on their retail portal. Transamerica will only accept the notarized document if uploaded to them by Notarize.com. Notarize keeps telling me they can’t do that because it was processed through their retail division. I’ve paid the notary fee as requested and Transamerica will not accept the notarized document if sent to them by me. The Notarize reps will not send me to a supervisor as I have requested multiple times.

Review.Titre: We had to call 4-5 times for a simple…
Review.Contenu: We had to call 4-5 times for a simple notary due to problems with audio. Also, when I tried to seek assistance, the notary assumed it was an interpreter and refused to move forward. This took much longer than necessary.

Review.Titre: DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME!
Review.Contenu: I connected with 3 notaries, 3 different times and each one could not notarize my document for various reasons, none of which were my fault.  One of the reasons was that the notary couldn't get the notarize.com website to send me a link to verify the ID of my 2 witnesses.  I went to so much trouble to provide 2 witnesses not related to me, only to have the notary say "sorry I can't help you".  I jumped through all the hoops, and still couldn't get my document notarized.  MASSIVE WASTE OF TIME!  DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME WITH THIS SITE.

Review.Titre: Color didn’t match my skin tone
Review.Contenu: The color didn’t match my skin tone, so I reached out to find out how to replace the makeup.  It has been over 48 hours, and I have yet to get a response.  Spending almost $100 on a bottle of foundation and concealer that I can’t use is pretty upsetting.

Review.Titre: Overstepping their bounds
Review.Contenu: The notary wanted to read a 120-page contract. His only job is to confirm that I am who I am, not decide whether the contract is good or bad or right or wrong. Notaries are here to prove that the signatory is who they say they are and that they are ok with signing the document. He wouldn't notarize for me and hung up the call.

Review.Titre: Identity theft waiting to happen
Review.Contenu: If you use them for ipostal.com, it's identity theft waiting to happen!!!  Neither my phone or computer would allow their photo id software to work. I attempted to take the photo of my drivers license eight times, six from my iphone and twice from my computer. When I got connected to the customer service rep, she had the nerve to ask me to disable my Norton to allow the software to work!  Are you kidding me? Run like hell from this company. Why do they need your location, ability to track you, and show you ads to notarize a document? Thank God for Norton or these crooks would have had my drivers license on the dark web for sale.

Review.Titre: The lady said I’m all set but I still…
Review.Contenu: The lady said I’m all set but I still got a text and email to do my notary after I signed and paid the notary and I have not receive my daughter’s birth certificate

Review.Titre: I paid to use this service to close on…
Review.Contenu: I paid to use this service to close on a property purchase I needed to complete while traveling overseas. I arranged my itinerary to sign the paperwork right after it became available at 12:01 CST. I completed the identity verification, uploaded copies of the documents, and so far I’ve been waiting for close to 4 hours for the notary to show up. I’m about to miss my flight. They are boasting 24/7 service, which is absolute nonsense and a blunt lie. I would not trust them with getting a credit card receipt signed at Starbucks and they definitely have no business facilitating a $600,000 Real Estate transaction.

Review.Titre: Huge waste of time.
Review.Contenu: The questions they ask to verify you kept coming back as another person. None of the questions were correct.  Kept locking us out and we could not notorize anything.  Complete waste of time.

Review.Titre: Terrible on-boarding and user…
Review.Contenu: Terrible on-boarding and user experience.When I got into the room with the notary, she said a few things then asked if it was okay to be recording the session. (1) There was no notice before entering the room that they would video record (2) It was already recording -- before I said "yes".  Then, when I got uncomfortable and started asking questions and expressing my concern about this process - including the fact that I'm in my home - she abruptly ended the session.Which meant that she DELETED all of the documentation and information I provided in the LENGTHY setup / on-boarding process. I had START OVER for asking legitimate questions.  Users should be transparently explained the process.Users should not be asked for consent for something that a business has already started doing, after the fact.This company has intentionally made it hard for users. And has not adequately trained its notaries to provide "actual" customer support. It's trained them to end calls if any questions arise.

Review.Titre: I had a very bad experience with a…
Review.Contenu: I had a very bad experience with a highly unfriendly and incompetent agent. The 2nd agent who tried to solve my problem was extrem unprofessional. The last agent (3rd) was easy going and had fixed my problem easily.

Review.Titre: Incorrect Information
Review.Contenu: Well, the notary was so desperate to get it signed that he told me we could add witnesses after the fact and that is not true as we can't alter the document now that he has notarized it.  I want my money back.  Thank you!

Review.Titre: TERMS AND CONDITIONS ARE ENDLESS
Review.Contenu: Notarize require the whole document to be uploaded not just the page where they witness your signature.  After I uploaded the document, I was redirected to a page with 5 links to contractual terms and conditions that I needed to accept.  I clicked on the first link that was a long contract of terms and conditions with about a dozen more embedded links and off to the sides were 4 more links to additional supplemental terms and conditions.  This was only the first link of some 4 or 5 links that I needed to accept.  If it was simple terms and conditions, no problem.  I'm not willing to agree and accept some 100 pages of terms and conditions for someone to notarize 1 page.

Review.Titre: I asked your notary prior to getting…
Review.Contenu: I asked your notary prior to getting notarized if it was acceptable in California for me to have a digital notary she said yes, that it was acceptable and I found out later that it was not which delayed my application for my birth certificate, which further delayed my application for housing and put me at risk of losing the spot open to rent at this facility for disabled people. I’ve been on the waitlist since 2018. And to make matters worse when I ask for a refund because I explain my situation, and I am not able to use this notarized document have to go pay for another notarized document. They did not give me a refund. Never using service again.

Review.Titre: End-to-end horrible
Review.Contenu: One of the worst online processes I've ever encountered. Online features don't work well. Reps -- that you HAVE TO talk to -- hang up after 1 second of technical problems that THEIR app causes.

Review.Titre: Very poor service and management.
Review.Contenu: I would like to make a complaint about the Notarize.com service. No one was able to solve the problem to notarize my document. They have a bad online customer service and a disastrous management software for document verification. In the end I had to carry out my management with another professional and efficient provider.

Review.Titre: Document was supposed to be notarized…
Review.Contenu: Document was supposed to be notarized for business purposes and yet the copy I have does not show the notarization and that information was also not sent to the appropriate people who needed to receive that. I have been dealing with this issue now since July 13th and have no resolve.

Review.Titre: Latinophobia - rude notary
Review.Contenu: The process to get the verification was very smooth but the notary we had was very rude. Spoke really fast and was not considerate that English is my second language. I understand and speak English but the notary was very very rude about it and hung up. Best to get a mobile notary to do the job for you instead

Review.Titre: aGENT DID NOT KNOW THAT THE DOCS COULD…
Review.Contenu: aGENT DID NOT KNOW THAT THE DOCS COULD NOT BE DIGITALLY SIGNED - SO MAKE SURE IT CAN BE DONE AND WORKS BECAUSE IT DOES NOT FOR NC CAR TITLE DOCS - ORIGINALS ONLY. WASTED $70.

Review.Titre: Technology failure; no ability for human over-ride
Review.Contenu: This process would have been great except that the automated system that confirms identity would not accept my, valid and current, government issued Driver's License and therefore couldn't confirm my identity.  No one could tell me why my license wasn't accepted.  As a result my closing was delayed 5-days and I incurred additional expense and work absences in order to make the closing happen. (I had to have my passport fedex'd to my location). Overall, I understand there can be technology glitches, however, a human should be able to intervene and fix the problem especially with something as financially important as a mortgage closing.

Review.Titre: Terrible User Experience
Review.Contenu: Had to use notarize for a remote settlement. It was a terrible user experience and the app constantly crashed. It was so bad the whole experience actually became quite laughable. Would never use it again.

Review.Titre: Zero Stars Not An Option
Review.Contenu: Meetings with notary kept dropping out (not due to my internet connection), forcing me to validate my identity over and over again. Additionally, the capability of the notaries was wildly different and I had to sign a document over 4 times due to incompetence. Would give zero stars but that is not an option.

Review.Titre: NONEXISTENT CUSTOMER SERVICE - YOU'RE JUST A NUMBER TO THEM.
Review.Contenu: The notary did a good job of notarizing the document, but she was in Virginia, and I needed a New York notarization after coming across the following NOTARIZE.COM website: (LINK REMOVED) I was under the impression I'd get a New York notary. It's my fault for not inquiring if she was a New York notary. Then again, she didn't ask either. There was no customer service number for me to call. I requested via customer service that they rectify it, but I continued to get nowhere with nonexistent customer service that you could tell really didn't care. I understand this happens to a lot of New Yorkers. I eventually found an alternative solution independently. You're best advised to exercise extreme caution, review your documents, and determine in which state you require notarization prior to contacting notarize.com for future assistance.

Review.Titre: 2 agents did not connect successfully
Review.Contenu: 2 agents did not connect successfully. I had to go thru verification 3 separate times to do this notary call

Review.Titre: Not accepted. Refused refund
Review.Contenu: I used them for a change of address document that was not accepted by the company due to the fact that the notary was not in a neighboring state and they refused to refund my money.

Review.Titre: Hung up on us
Review.Contenu: The notary kept complaining on the signing taking too long. He hung up on us after 2 of 8 documents were completed.

Review.Titre: I have to keep getting support for…
Review.Contenu: I have to keep getting support for notorial errors on documents or billing errors. They’ve all been satisfactorily resolved, but I’m spending my time fixing mistakes that weren’t mine.

Review.Titre: Overcharged/Poor customer service
Review.Contenu: I was overcharged due to what is an issue with your system and customer service refused to remedy the situation.  Very disappointed and will follow up with both TIAA and Notaruze management.

Review.Titre: Notarize doesn't have any notaries
Review.Contenu: Between yesterday and today, I have initiated 5 different sessions with Notarize to have this document notarized. I've waited hours and hours longer than Notarize's estimated wait time. Today, I contacted Notarize, and the woman I chatted with said she sees fewer notaries available than usual, said that the average wait time is 10 minutes (even though I've waited well over 30 minutes EACH time),  and told me to try a different day or contact iPostal to see if they can help me get it notarized. I cannot keep delaying this, as I already have my mail starting to forward to this new address tomorrow. This experience has been incredibly slow and awful thus far. Can someone please help me notarize this document? I used Postscan Mail on 3 separate occasions in the past for several businesses of mine, and the notarize process was always instant. Clearly, Notarize is not a very good notary solution. Please help me.

Review.Titre: Frustrating
Review.Contenu: Sign on process was easy, providing documentation to prove my identity went smoothly, but when attempting to get on a call with one of their notaries they were not present and was frustrating. Lack of customer support only made this worse, especially once they locked my account after booting me from the meeting.

Review.Titre: Notary didn't sign in block 14a so I…
Review.Contenu: Notary didn't sign in block 14a so I was refunded and had to start over. I'm using another notary so they don't waste my time again.

Review.Titre: They can't notarize out of state
Review.Contenu: They did not tell me that someone from out of state can't notarize a document. I paid and now they refuse to refund. Shouldn't they know these things?

Review.Titre: Worst Customer Service Ever
Review.Contenu: I applied for a notary which I got done very easily. But the payment process was a failure.I couldn't make a payment.  Your customer service couldn't send me a link to pay.  They kept saying I have to log into my account. What account I never made an account or set a password. I didn't even know the company name or website. Because I got a link from a mail box service to use you for notary. Customer service kept telling me to log in. Where am I to log in no links provided and what's my user name. Review.Titre: Generic notarization not allowed in New York
Review.Contenu: I needed a document notarized and specifically searched for a notary for Ulster County, New York. The company specifically stated they can support the request. After completing the A/V check and uploading identification. The notary was from Florida; this was unknown until after payment was made. New York State only allows remote online notarization:N.Y. Exec. Law § 135-C4. Types of electronic notarial acts.(a) Any notarial act authorized by section one hundred thirty-five of this article may be performed electronically as prescribed by this section if: (i) for execution of any instrument in writing, under applicable law that document may be signed with an electronic signature and the notary public is reasonably able to confirm that such instrument is the same instrument in which the principal made a statement or on which the principal executed a signature; and (ii) the electronic notary public is located within the state of New York at the time of the performance of an electronic notarial act using communication technology, regardless of the location of the document signer.The company would not refund fee; notarized document completed by this company is not accepted in New York. I do not recommend this company.

Eventually we found the first document we loaded for 2 signers and when my name came up the 2nd time we replaced it with my co-signers name and it worked. The process was frustrating and exhausting.

Review.Titre: Software Issues
Review.Contenu: I had all kinds of difficulty understanding how to use the Notarize software. It took me several attempts and a lot of time to be able to use it. Once I figured it out, the process went well. I am not a software expert. But I am an intermediate user, and I have successfully used eSign with ease on several previous online transactions. It would be very helpful for first time users like me to have a better set of how-to-use instructions that include screenshots of each step.When I first accessed/opened Notarize is asked if I was logging on myself, or if my wife and I were logging in together. I selected together, but the software would only accept my signature. So, we had to do log on separately and each sign all the pages. This took essentially twice the amount of time to do all the signatures. It would have been a lot more efficient it we could have logged on together and both of us could sign each page.

Review.Titre: Have the Technical Help Number Before You Start
Review.Contenu: Initially, the process went well; but, then it went sideways. There was a step in verifying identity where a form of identification had to be photographed. it started of talking about using a smartphone; but only gave the optional way, using your computer camera, on that page. The computer camera could not get a focused enough picture for the info to be read by the system doing the verifying and we could not get it right after multiple attempts as it’s a Facetime camera and not a read the fine print camera. Once we called and got technical help, we found out we just had to keep going through the steps to get to the smartphone method. My suggestion would be to NOT let the optional method be used on the initial screen and have more precise and informative instructions as to the process to photograph your ID.

Review.Titre: It's LAME When Your Service Saves People Money, Until They Get Your Bill & They've Saved ZERO
Review.Contenu: The service was easy enough but logically, it makes no sense to me that I was charged almost TWICE as much, had I done it somewhere in the city. Getting something notarized online means BOTH the notary & I don't have to get ready, get in our cars, waste money on gasoline, pollute the air with having to drive, put wear and tear on our vehicle: this mode of getting something notarized costs SOOO much more time, money, and energy than popping on a zoom sesh for 5-6 minutes, so why does notarize.com gotta ruin such a good thing by making it cost me twice as much money?

Review.Titre: The first notary didn't speak English…
Review.Contenu: The first notary didn't speak English well enough for a notary. He tried his best repeating and emphasizing words, but I couldn't understand what he was saying.So, he cancelled the notarization.That resulted in me having to start from scratch. It's about 10-15 minutes of dancing with your phone, trying to take the pictures of your IDs for the system's liking.Also: for the 2nd time, you have to create an account on the notary site. It takes an additional time.The notarization itself (time with the notary) kind of quick. However, because I had the 1st notary who didn't speak English well enough to be a notary, it took me about 45 minutes total, instead of the promised 10-15.It's very unpleasant and boring experience, too. Taking ideal pictures making sure light is perfect, angles are perfect, etc. I challenge you to take a perfect picture of your SHINY passport that wants to close on its own 5000 times. To make sure you understand what I am talking about. THEN you have to take a picture of the page with the signature in the same manner, etc.

However, before I could get a picture of the requested signature page, a pop-up obscured the page and there was no way to continue (except to click "my camera is not working" which was not the problem). This happened on multiple attempts using two different up-to-date browsers (Chrome and Edge). I then tried an iPhone 7 which hung trying to get the second picture. I had to boot it and restart Safari with no open tabs to finally get it to work.

Review.Titre: On the way for a good product but NOT there yet
Review.Contenu: The notary was awesome and made the experience palatable.  BUT if I knew it would take sooooo much longer to sign my sellers docs with this method I definitely would not have done it.  It took me 4 times longer to use this product!   Typing in ALL the info on the form… I didn’t expect.  When I reviewed the docs ahead of time I Assumed they would be filled in when I signed…. As that was the norm the 8or 9 times I’ve bought and sold houses. Then I was a POA on this property, so I had to also type in two additional names and conditions (as attorney in fact).  Really?! How about a macro to fill that in? Or have it preprinted?  For Michigan the number of documents I had to sign were fewer than I’ve done for other states but again, it took me longer than ANY other signing I’ve done (in California, Washington and Michigan) I thought “notarized” would be efficient, but it was NOT. It took almost 4 hours from the review the doc to signing off of the call.  Had I known I would have had someone come to my home again from a local branch of the title company with preprinted forms and signed them in half or a third of the time “notarized” took. To the company: I recommend 1) sending the docs early ie day before…and advising people to read over and letting them know they’ll be filling them out.  (Fortunately I had most of the info on hand … but not all of it!). 15 min I was advised in email to review docs before getting on line is not enough time to review them.2) establish macros or click boxes for proxies or POAs.. way too time consuming to type in their names etc. 3) explain the process NOT just how to get on line, so people have the data in front of them (If it’s truly a necessity to type in the data with online notary).I think you have many elements of a good product but until you further develop it and reduce the interface time I will not use it again. Thank you for asking! I wish you good luck to further develop it. 😊
