A government ID is required for a notary of signature not almost the entire social security number tied to other identifying information that could obtained ( assumption your selling ) and used for identity theft or worse .

Review.Titre: It took at least 5 tries over two days…
Review.Contenu: It took at least 5 tries over two days to get one document signed and eventually required the ticket to be forwarded on to engineering to manually fix whatever the issue was.The price was good but there are definitely some technical issues that need to be ironed out before I'd recommend this to anyone.

Review.Titre: I needed a document notarized that the…
Review.Contenu: I needed a document notarized that the agent told me needed to be done by a Texas notary.  They put me back in the cue and could not route me to a Texas notary.  They told to me to keep trying until I, by chance, was connected to a Texas notary.  Are you kidding?  Your service needs some work.

Review.Titre: I gave a poor rating because Notary.com…
Review.Contenu: I gave a poor rating because Notary.com should know if documents are legal being notarized outside of California for a California resident. We had to have our docs notarized again in California to be valid.The notary herself was a wonderful and helpful person.

Review.Titre: Carefull
Review.Contenu: So they're job is to double check and verify with you that the information given is true. Well google autofilled some lines in for me after i already filled them in. The notarizer never pointd out the fact that a both the names of the husband and wife were the same. 140$ down the drain.

Review.Titre: The service works well BUT my lawyer wouldn't accept the docs!
Review.Contenu: The site is easy to use, and the notary who helped me was great. BUT, my lawyer wouldn't accept the out-of-state notarization on divorce settlement documents that we have to submit to the court (in MA). So, I did it in person with a lawyer here for $3 after spending $35 at Notarize for electronic docs I couldn't use. Next time, I'll just use a local notary.

Review.Titre: Smooth and easy
Review.Contenu: I Jane used this service twice. My phone was not able to scan my ID - the camera view comes up as a black window on my iPhone13 Pro Max. Maybe I was using Chrome instead of Safari. Fortunately I also had my laptop. Otherwise it was smooth and easy and well worth it - since I’m not in the US and embassies have super limited access.

Review.Titre: The notarization was not accepted
Review.Contenu: The notarization was not accepted, so my form was rejected by the institution. I paid 35$ to for one notary signature that was notarizing my wife and I's signature. The document was rejected because it was not "Docusigned". If you are electronically signing a document, it should be docusigned. This company does not provide that, so in many situations you will be wasting your money. Experience was good otherwise.

Review.Titre: the notary herself was delightful BUT
Review.Contenu: the notary herself was delightful - but attorneys deemed it not valid and required actual ink - naturally after payment and the entire process was completed.  I feel like either notarize should make you aware that some states or regions would not accept it, or the platform should be smart enough via its questions to know.

Review.Titre: I felt the process awkward and…
Review.Contenu: I felt the process awkward and disconnected. I ended up paying for two signatures even though I only needed one. My suspicion is the way it is set up on SignNow and how it is interpreted on your end. In any case I don't anticipate recommending it to my co-workers.

Review.Titre: Your web page was extremely difficult…
Review.Contenu: Your web page was extremely difficult to access!  Once I finally got in your security questions were a little difficult.  Who can remember the zip code of a house sold 16 years ago? Two days ago I finally got to a notary but she she was extremely unhelpful so I told her i’d try again with someone else. Yesterday, I went through the whole process again.  This notary had no problem and guided me through the signing process with ease!

Review.Titre: i was overcharged for this notary…
Review.Contenu: i was overcharged for this notary service. i had one document notarized. iit needed a notary stamp in 3-4 places on the form. i asked the notary, who was very nice, would there be more than one charge . she told me there would only be one fee ($20). instead the invoice was for $45. i was pissed off, but after spending 20-25 min , paid it. this was not right!!

Review.Titre: Spent an hour with a notary for a…
Review.Contenu: Spent an hour with a notary for a mortgage package. When I received the documents the entire loan doc package was not signed. I contacted chat and was told there was no way to correct and no refunds. I paid $85 and did not have a valid document. I had to do it all over again

Review.Titre: Frustrating app
Review.Contenu: I used the app to take a photo of my documents and they uploaded horizontal instead of vertically for some reason. Once I was connected with a live notary he was unable to flip the document resulting in me having to start the whole process over. What could have taken 15 min ended up taking well over an hour of troubleshooting and using a 3rd party app to scan the documents, save them and upload them to this app. Frustrating.

Review.Titre: Check regulations before using.
Review.Contenu: The notarize process is simple and easily executed. Unfortunately the notary was out of state. The state of Texas DMV does not accept electronic signatures and the notary from Virginia would not sign on the document but attached a separate document with the notary signature, which is also not allowed in Texas. $25 for nothing. Suggest anyone using this service be certain electronic signatures are allowed and whether notary attachments are allowed.

Review.Titre: Needs upload ability
Review.Contenu: Needs upload ability! Inexplicably, the process forces you to take a photograph of supporting documents rather than simply uploading a picture or PDF. I wasted $25 and a good deal of time trying to print and photograph a utility bill, which was then just later rejected because the photograph was too blurry.

Review.Titre: I am hired by Escrow companies and RE…
Review.Contenu: I am hired by Escrow companies and RE Attorneys to meet with their clients and sign documents. The notarize.com platform is not set up for my business and doesn't allow me to access the signed documents after the signing is complete. I have to ask the customer that signed the documents to email them to my client. This does not work for my business and has made it tough for me to use this platform.

Review.Titre: Easy experience, but unfortunately did not work
Review.Contenu: The experience was easy, but unfortunately the digital notarized documents were not accepted by the attorney and I ended up having to go get them re-notarized in person.  I wish it would have worked because it was easy and convenient and the notary was super polite, but unfortunately digital notarized documents are not accepted most places.

Review.Titre: Notarize pays the Notary $5 and charges you $25.
Review.Contenu: Notarize.com charges $25 as a base transaction charge which covers one document and one notarization (seal) and $10 for any additional seal. However, they only pay the Certified Notary $5 out of the base transaction fee and $1 for any additional seal. The company makes bank and pays the notary pennies.

Review.Titre: Efficient but not knowledgable
Review.Contenu: While this was quick and efficient, the Notary that helped me didn't know all the places that needed to be signed on the document I had. I asked where it needed to be signed. She just replied with the question where do you need to sign? I didn't know and wasn't sure. She was of NO help and I ended up paying for a notarization in some places and blank in another where it needed to be signed. Now I have to pay AGAIN for the same document to have my signature on there notarized. I am truly unhappy.

Review.Titre: The first step of notarizing happened…
Review.Contenu: The first step of notarizing happened fast but the problem is in proving it to other parties. your support in this regard is poor and I am loosing a lot of money as they are asking me to prove it. there is actually no tools for this purpose in your website. Third party has asked the solicitor by e-mail a few days ago but no response yet.

Review.Titre: Modifications for elderly
Review.Contenu: I was assisting an elderly man who could not hear the notary. He was also struggling with seeing the computer screen. When I attempted to assist him I was told that the notary would not notarize the process if I didn’t remain quiet. I understand that the notary wanted to be sure he wasn’t being forced into the process, however, when completing the process of withdrawing money from a retirement account, there should be modifications made for those who struggle with seeing and hearing.

Review.Titre: Caution: Professional service - but not widely accepted
Review.Contenu: I was quite impressed by this service. Professional, organized and a fairly seamless process. However, when I submitted the notarized documents to L.A. County, the notarized documents were rejected and I will now have to find an alternate solution. If the party receiving the documents will accept something notarized by Notarize.com, then you're in luck. It is a handy service. However in case they don't, I highly recommend that you confirm ahead of time with whomever is requesting the documents to cover yourself and save yourself some time and money.

Review.Titre: The files I received were in a zip file…
Review.Contenu: The files I received were in a zip file that didn't extract easily as others I;ve done before and even Tech support had problems, also your contact email site gave only an error code and your contact phone # consistently gave a message that it wasn't a valid #, so customer service was zilch and It still appears that the document, which I uploaded and finally was acknowledged, hasn't shown up in my account!!

Review.Titre: Great people, terrible tech.
Review.Contenu: The woman was great, but their platform is the worst. The first notary that came on couldn't hear me or I couldn't hear her and instead of allowing me to fix it, 45 seconds in, she just disconnected and I had to go through it all again.

Review.Titre: Out  of State Notary not valid
Review.Contenu: Though the agent was very efficient in stating his purpose, one thing he failed to mention us that a Texas notary is not valid in New York State. The website should also prominently display this information that certain states may not accept out of state notaries. I want my $25 back!

Review.Titre: Our bank stated they needed an…
Review.Contenu: Our bank stated they needed an electronic journal or record made by the notary for the POA that was electronically signed. I asked for you to provide this since I paid for a service you provided. However you gave me confusing instructions. I'm 80 years old, why can you not just provide these documents?

Review.Titre: your website support tips page is down.
Review.Contenu: your website support tips page is down.your agent tried all sorts of ways to help, but not trained enough to solve the problem.Your website could not read my webcam that I use on regular basis w zoom.No, zoom was not on when I was on Notarize.Very clumsy desktop app. Slightly better phone app, which is not really secure for important documents.Phone app does not allow you to sin on paper and scan. I had to sign with my finger tip. Looks weird.

Review.Titre: I waited almost 2 hours on-line for…
Review.Contenu: I waited almost 2 hours on-line for next available notary as well as for about 45 min for my document get done. I previously used notarized.com and they were more efficient. I found big differences in process of notarization and felt it was not as thorough. At the end, document looked finished and accepted by requesting party. I suggest to improve scheduling/waiting time and have documents prepared during on-line time with customer.

Review.Titre: Great if you have a PC, not for IOS
Review.Contenu: I had a document sent to me for a new job. It said I could use IOS so I tried multiple times on my iPhone, the app kept crashing at the end of the review step. I tried on my iPad, same problem. Tried in a chrome tab but it would force use of the app, which crashed. Both IOS devices had all appropriate system updates. Finally, I had to borrow a PC and then it worked great. I had a long wait for a notary but I didn’t mind that part. He was very nice and helpful.

Review.Titre: Incomplete Job
Review.Contenu: I’ll explain the low rating:  When I contacted TransAmerica, who was to receive my notarized documents from notarize.com, I was informed that page one was missing. This was a very important, time-sensitive document that I entrusted to the care of notarize.com; however, they failed to do a thorough job with delivery of the document.Additionally, the notary we dealt with was not friendly though she was professional.

Review.Titre: Definitely NOT worth it
Review.Contenu: What a pain this process was. It actually would have been SO much easier to simply get in our car and drive a few minutes to our bank where it would have been FREE! People were nice and professional but simply put: It’s not worth $50 to get two signatures notarized.

Review.Titre: The call eneded with out my signature…
Review.Contenu: The call eneded with out my signature on the notory and there was a blue box instead of the signature at some places where I was suppose to sign. The person who did the notory could not hear me and did not bother to check if the document had my signatures before ending the call.

Review.Titre: The company says it can notarise…
Review.Contenu: The company says it can notarise anytime but only available during the US working hours, the personal was in a hurry and not concerned about how difficult that the tools used were taking not so good quality photos, it was a mess, but somehow I got this verification done.

Review.Titre: Once I finally got service it wasn't…
Review.Contenu: Once I finally got service it wasn't bad.  The woman was very friendly, but the first person didn't know what they were doing and I ended up on hold basically for an hour.  And they were supposed to send my notarized document direct to the company who sent me to them, to use their service, and they failed to do that also.

Review.Titre: Use this to try and notarize…
Review.Contenu: Use this to try and notarize requirements for security and exchange, but the form needing such was not done and it been difficult to get the proper treatment to correct this procedure.  We are unable to proceed in our process without the necessary form being notarize. Need help in this area

Review.Titre: Failed to know that large notarized pdf was not delivered
Review.Contenu: I notarized a 29 MB pdf. It got larger after the stamps. Although notarize.com sent me a notice that the notarized file has been sent to my employer, in reality, the employer server had rejected the file due to size. No one knew about the mishap for days.Moreover, when I needed to shrink the pdf to resend by myself, notarized doc was locked by the notary against modifications. Direct email of the doc using the notarize.com link also could not succeed,What a mess!!!!Should give me my money back.

Review.Titre: The system would not verify my documents
Review.Contenu: The system would not verify my identification.  I used several phones with different levels of cameras. I spent hours trying to get it to work.  Only on the last day did Customer Support suggest I use the computer browser.  In addition I did not have documents which could confirm my address in English.  It wasnt until I was several days into this process that Customer Support explained how I could use foreign language documents.It would help if your instructions did make reference to clients who are using the service and live overseas or at least an FAQ.

Review.Titre: Although it is a convenience
Review.Contenu: Although it is a convenience, in theory, to be able to notarize documents online, the two experiences I have had, one yesterday and one today, each lasted hours (only 3 documents each time), and they were frustrating, purgatorial hours.  In future, I will make every effort to seek out a flesh and blood notary.

Review.Titre: Time consuming and complicated
Review.Contenu: The only pro was that the notary lady was very nice and helpful. I still do not recommend that service. It is way more complicated and time consuming than going to a local notary. Plus it cost more. On top they should have submitted the form automatically to the recommending partner company which did not happen. I don´t know if that was the fault of notarize.com or their partner though.

Review.Titre: The app itself is good and very useful - support need improvement
Review.Contenu: The app itself is good and very useful. The support need to learn more about their product so that they can better assist customers. Documents that are notarized sometimes are very important legal docs and having this company hold it due to their technical error and inability of support to help could jeopardize a case.

Review.Titre: I thought the service was great
Review.Contenu: I thought the service was great. It was easy to use and the notary was very thorough and helpful. My problem was that the title agency overseeing the sale of my condo did not accept the virtual signatures and so I had to go out and have it done by another local notary.

Review.Titre: The instructions for using this service…
Review.Contenu: The instructions for using this service need to be re-written.  They are not clear on the steps that need to be taken.  Chat is courteous, but only repeats what the instructions say and are not any more helpful.  It was a very difficult process to use this service.

Review.Titre: Unhappy
Review.Contenu: The interaction was slow but I did manage to get two documents notarized.  The copies received by the requesting company were UNSIGNED.  We lost almost a week trying to retrieve our own money but we did pay Notarize much more quickly and efficiently.  We are not happy.

Review.Titre: Interface not easy to work with
Review.Contenu: The notary was great, and very patient.  The interface was not great, and it took a long time to complete the notarization process.  I needed to sign the document with my full name, but didn’t sign using my middle name at first.  We were unable to get rid of the original signature, and wound up having to use handwritten initials in a work around.  But overall, the process was quite long, and didn’t save any time versus going to my local bank to get the document notarized.

Review.Titre: Overstepping Notary Role
Review.Contenu: I hired the service to witness a signature. I did not request them to proofread my document. I advised the notary that I was given specific instructions on how to fill out the form. The notary insisted that my document was filled out wrong and refused to notarize it if I did not allow her to change one of the fields. Sure enough, my company would not accept the form with the notary's changes! I had to go to a different notary and pay another fee for a new form. The notarize (dot) com notary should have listened to me, and not overstepped the scope of her role.

Review.Titre: Poor multi-language
Review.Contenu: I did try to join Spanish meeting many times but was not any operator online and My english its very bad. I did join english meeting but was not so good, because my language, as feedback should be more people that Speak spanish at Notarize.  Best regards.

Review.Titre: A notary dropped my call
Review.Contenu: A notary dropped my call, and I had to start the whole process over. I could have gone to my bank and completed the process for free rather than pay $25 for what turned out to be a longer and less convenient process. I will definitely go to my bank the next time.

Review.Titre: Rep Was Great But Process Is Bad
Review.Contenu: Sonya the Rep was WONDERFUL but the process to get there wasn't. I have to fill out the forms 5 times and one time the notary couldn't find the form to notarize so she canceled that one.  Very cumbersome, unclear process.  Also I have to have WinZip in order to open my copy.  I don't have that!

Review.Titre: OK job
Review.Contenu: You did a good job with the notarization process and your notary was efficient and friendly. However, the notarized document was not sent to the parties that needed it, even though I supplied their email addresses.

Review.Titre: Very convenient but I would like to see…
Review.Contenu: Very convenient but I would like to see a way of uploading your proof documents. Taking a picture with camera is not easy

Review.Titre: He was perfect and very efficient…
Review.Contenu: He was perfect and very efficient however should have some warning somewhere that in some cases online out of state notaries aren't acceptable. Which was the case in my situation. I couldn't use it because the notary had to be in NY STATE where I am.

Review.Titre: I had no problem with entering my…
Review.Contenu: I had no problem with entering my personal data and getting it notarized online. Thanks for making it very convenient. However, when it came to getting my wife notarized it was extremely complicated and I just gave up. It wasn’t clear that she couldn’t be notarized online and the resultant confusion led me to simply quit the process.

Review.Titre: Convenient But Needs Some Work
Review.Contenu: After completing all signing and the first notary person logged on, something happened with their wifi and the person disappeared. Customer service stated when this happens you have to re-sign all your loan docs/start the process over again to get to a notary. It’s frustrating to lose all that work because your notary has a poor wifi connection.

Review.Titre: Taking pictures of my documents.
Review.Contenu: The actual process of signing the document was easy and fast.  However, getting to that point was difficult.  I could not take the pictures of my verifying docs (passport and license) for some reason. The button to take the picture was not functioning.  I called for assistance and was on the phone for fifteen minutes before a person answered and they could not help.  So, I repeated the process from the beginning four or five times before it actually worked.

Review.Titre: It would have been a five-star…
Review.Contenu: It would have been a five-star experience, but we had to start over when one document was not correct. While that issue was not the fault of notarize, we had terrible technical issues when we had to go back in to redo the closing. None of the correct documents saved, so we had to redo all the documents. We couldn’t get the code to verify email, and the tech issues just kept coming. It took over an hour to get back into the system. Our notary, Mark H, was excellent. He was very professional and arranged to be back with us for the do-over.

Review.Titre: Notarize was very difficult to get…signed in
Review.Contenu: Notarize was very difficult to get logged into. We went through 52 pages of preliminary paperwork with no problem, then when it asked for copies of our Driver’s Licenses, it would copy the front, but would lock up when we tried to do the back. Then we tried getting into Notarize, and a rep came on asking if we wanted our Driver’s License notarized, we said no, we want our Closing documents notarized. She couldn’t find them. Finally a rep was able to get us on Chrome, where we finally were able to log in. Our closing was scheduled for 2:30, we finally got in about 3:45. The notary was very nice and we went through the signing quite quickly. Then on the last page, it blanked out, but we were able to reconnect within a few seconds. It was quite frustrating.

Review.Titre: Disappointed, Image software is a thumbs down
Review.Contenu: I have used other competing online notaries with my current Samsung A8 and they had far superior photo imaging software, yours was very very difficult to get a legible image. Your notary was very good, my low rating is based only on your poor image software. Your not just a little behind your competition but a lot. Nothing personal but would not use your service again.

Review.Titre: Great, but wasn't acceptable for my application
Review.Contenu: I thought the experience was quick and easy and cheap. And would have been great had they been accepted by the FAA. The FAA classified the signatures as ink signatures since it did not have the digital authentication next to it. And therefore was not digitally signed. I had to reprint and get a local notary to sign and resend it. This was for an aircraft registration.

Review.Titre: Connection problems and identification questions unnecessary
Review.Contenu: PROS:- Able to get my documents notarized while traveling abroad.- Once a connection was established, went quickly and smoothly.CONS:- I don't like the identification questions. Fortunately this time questions were ok and able to answer correctly. But I think that this requirement is unnecessary since we already need to provide a government ID.- First attempt had a connection issue so was kicked out of the system and had to start over.

Review.Titre: Expensive notary
Review.Contenu: This was a new experience doing a notary online. I’m dismayed at the cost. I used to be a notary republic in Calif and by law we were not allowed to charge more than $10. Why is your cost so high? Unfortunately for me, I had no choice as I needed a copy of my grandmother’s death certificate quickly.

Review.Titre: Doesn’t give the state until Notary appears
Review.Contenu: It all went smoothly and worthy 5 stars. However, I googled NEW YORK Notary-they were the first to pop up and nowhere during the process did it say otherwise, until the actual Notary appeared and said he was a Florida notary under Florida law and didn’t know whether it would be accepted in any other state. This should be specified at the beginning of the process-let us be able to choose the state we need so we can see if you cover the stage requested. Now if NYC court doesn’t accept this notarization I have to go and pay twice. Not good.

Review.Titre: The online process was difficult and…
Review.Contenu: The online process was difficult and when I finally got to a notary she couldn't make the completed form work. She told me to redo the whole process. I redid it and the next guy completed things no problem, but when I then went on to pay I was charged twice and had to call Notarize.Clumsy experience all around.

Review.Titre: Your software or system is ‘buggy’ at…
Review.Contenu: Your software or system is ‘buggy’ at best. I’d give it a 1/5. I finally received my password resets (5 of them) 5 hours after the request. Long after we completed the transaction, which fortunately for me, you have great support people and I was able to  complete the online document signing and notarization. So five stars for support, 1 star for ‘Notarize’.

Review.Titre: The customer support was superlative
Review.Contenu: The customer support was superlative! However, the fact that we needed customer support was disappointing. We needed to notarize documents for a real estate sale. This normally is a simple stress free function. Doing it online was extremely stressful due to the incomplete instructions that were sent. I recommend that you take an individual over 70 and walk them through the process and pay attention to all their questions, and then create your instructions for your customers.

Review.Titre: Loved the Convenience; Notary Should Have Paid Better Attention
Review.Contenu: I LOVED the convenience. However, the notary notarized the wrong section of a second document, and now we'll probably have to resubmit it again...which means we'll be charged again!  Closer and better attention should have been paid to where the notary put her stamp!!!

Review.Titre: From the point of view of a first time…
Review.Contenu: From the point of view of a first time user, I personally think that representative should be more helpful, patient and knowledgeable. My first representative wasn't very helpful, however, my second representative was very helpful,  friendly and attentive. Therefore, my mission was accomplished successfully from the second try! Thank you very much Daniell! I really appreciate your help!

Review.Titre: It was professionally handled but it…
Review.Contenu: It was professionally handled but it took much longer than we expected given that it was a cash sale and everything was pretty straightforward. Overall happy with the experience because the notary was professional and clearly had expertise in the matter. Just would have liked a quicker turnover time

Review.Titre: Good product, bad support
Review.Contenu: The software and on-demand notaries are incredible.  With that being said, it's a little pricey and the customer service is very, very bad.  I've had billing issues and any time we contact our account manager it feels like they don't care at all if we are a customer.  Note that as I say that, we spent over $25,000 on Notarize.com last year, so while we know we aren't their largest client, we aren't the smallest either, and we can't get decent support.

Review.Titre: First Notery we communicated with was…
Review.Contenu: First Notery we communicated with was very curse and did not want to provide service.The second Notery was very pleasant and provided support and helped us through the process.

Review.Titre: Use Phone App For A Smoother Experience…
Review.Contenu: Your phone app provides a smoother experience than the desktop web app. Attempted to notarize on a Saturday past midnight before a holiday. Was patched through to a notary but the connection was severed halfway through. I tried 4 times with the desktop approach just to return to a video call. I gave up until the morning and tried the phone app instead — which worked far better.

Review.Titre: The preparation process was difficult, good notary.
Review.Contenu: The preparation process was confusing. My wife and I were both attending the online notarization, and we both timed out, since we started ahead of time (we were on separate laptops). This is understandable. But then we both had to re-enter our information, picture ids, retake the speed test, etc.The instructions said we'd have a chance to review docs before meeting the notary, but neither of us had an opportunity. Maybe we both missed it.We both got multiple emails with links to start the process, which is fine, but the one titled "Verify your email address" had a link that was confusing - it took us to our account, which was not useful for what we were currently doing, but later.I contacted support about the missing chance to review documents, and they were helpful.Also, the notary was very helpful, and gave us plenty of time as we went through the document. She dealt well with a little lag that happened during the signing process.

Review.Titre: Good
Review.Contenu: Good, but Its is missing some information, about waiting, It says 8 minutes, but on Saturday I spent more than 2 hours waiting.On the next Monday and business day, the process was very fast and easy. thank you

Review.Titre: fine but software needs work
Review.Contenu: The system made me verify my ID Everytime I got to that point instead of once which was a pain. Also there was a glitch on the last page where it would not let me sign which made me try re logging in and it still didn’t work. The notary said that this had happened before which is problematic if someone has limited time to sign something

Review.Titre: Too many inaccurate emails.
Review.Contenu: The service is reasonably convenient to use but email communication needs some work. If multiple people need to sign a document I get notices that the document isn't complete even after I sign it. So especially when I have multiple documents to sign the misleading emails obscure what really needs to be done.

Review.Titre: It’s a great service , but you need patience
Review.Contenu: It’s a great service ,because let me notarize a selling contract while traveling overseas. You need patience and some help to be able to use it, because it’s not user friendly. I had to try couple times to prove that I am who I I am because the security questions sometimes wasn’t straightforward.The help section have a  live chat which really saved me from giving up and I was happy when after couple of hours finally I was connected to the notary, who was extremely professional.Also was frustrating to wait 24 hours after two times  I couldn’t pass the identification process .I’m  wondering how someone who doesn’t have my knowledge about using a computer can use it?Also better to start out on their website instead of the link you get true email, because then you can’t open the verification email, which let you change the password to be able to get to the documents.Maybe the most problem was that my US  phone was out of service because of international traveling  so I couldn’t receive text identification .

Review.Titre: I was not satisfied because the…
Review.Contenu: I was not satisfied because the instructions stated that I could use a photo id and a utility bill proof of address. And instead I was asked for a second photo ID with address on it. LET ME ASK YOU, what form of photo ID other then a drivers license has an address stated on it? I have two passports (dual citizen) and none of them have addresses. One photo ID with address and a second id like passport without address should be more then sufficient...since the government also accepts that no matter where you go!

Review.Titre: Delivery of document much too slow
Review.Contenu: At first I was pleased with the ease of notarizing online. Supposedly they send the notarized document directly to me bank. But when I checked back after several days they told me the process takes 5-7 days, which was not disclosed in advance. In this case the document was urgent and - had I known - I would have sent the document myself.

Review.Titre: There are innate problems with the process
Review.Contenu: The notary was excellent and guided us through the process, however this was our first experience with an online notary, and we found it tedious and time consuming. There are too many things that can go wrong, from the internet connection to the camera and microphone functioning, and I had several starts and restarts.

Review.Titre: The instructions could have been more…
Review.Contenu: The instructions could have been more clear.I wanted to review the documents before signing them but had trouble finding them on the Notarize.com web page.

Review.Titre: The wait queue time was not correct
Review.Contenu: The wait queue time was not correct. It showed 16 minutes and after half an hour it still showed 16 minutes. I had to terminate the session and restart again.It doesn't provide possibility to scan front and back of the document.

Review.Titre: Took better part of afternoon!
Review.Contenu: The system itself is easy and great flow. Then when uploading docs after choosing for iPhone or desk top that’s where the problem is. So I went to work on desk top bc that’s where my documents are. Then there’s no option to upload them. Mush be a photo. 6 times when trying to take photo it showed accept yet when I scheduled with notary he said perfect but then they get rejected as couldnt read. Should have been an easy process but took well over an hour. It was frustrating to get an email that response could be up to 48 hours. Fortunately it only took the afternoon. I chose o line as thought would be faster. I could have driven to a notary much quicker after all. Someone should walk through the steps and try and see what issues come up and then improve the system.

Review.Titre: It works. Have patience.
Review.Contenu: I like that the notary is available 24/7 and the actual meeting was easy. I dislike that I didn’t know services were available around the clock until I uploaded my documents and notarization was delayed because I thought normal business hours were in effect. Also I found the document upload process somewhat frustrating: sometimes the pictures would automatically capture; other times I’d click the button and nothing would happen. Several times I received errors regarding network issues on the notarize site. 3 stars because it did eventually work and accomplished the stated goal.

Review.Titre: There is a software issue with the second document upload option
Review.Contenu: The second option to upload the document or vehicle registration card software camera does not work and the image is not clear. So I have to upload the document nearly 10 times.The document gives the perfect image on my camera but on the software it gives a very blury image on the second document option.There is a software issue on the second document upload option.This has to be rectified immediately.

Review.Titre: Notary was great, minimum age not so great.
Review.Contenu: Our notary was great, fast, efficient, and friendly. However, the „no notarized documents for under18“ policy was frustrating. We still have to find a notary for our child‘s signature.

Review.Titre: Mixed review.
Review.Contenu: Did not work well from mobile device.  Seemed to only work from desktop computer.  Several of us had to start over when the notary dropped off.  Sometimes the camera did not work to capture ID.Very clever software though and seems to have a bright future.

Review.Titre: Check your software
Review.Contenu: Check your software, it does not work like it should...struggled to get pics done with my cellphone. The complete pic works okay but the pic only of the signature shows extremely clear however does not want to register. Now if you were to give us a click button to take the pic when we see it being clear as you do on the other device, it would be great. One of your notaries shut down the app so I had to start all over again, took me over an hor to finally get the notary done. Did not speak with her, I saw an empty seat when the camera came on, and then she just shut it all down, turned it off. Will not struggle like that again, I will try someone else right away at the first sign of a struggle.

Review.Titre: Good service, a bit difficult if you don't speak English
Review.Contenu: It is not easy to get notaries who speak Spanish, which makes the process difficult for Hispanic people who do not speak English. Beyond that clarification, the service is very safe and fast, they do a great job.

Review.Titre: Buggy
Review.Contenu: Buggy. Couldn't upload document, then couldn't take photo of my ID.I want an option to upload ID instead of take a photo of another screen.Safari on iPad

Review.Titre: I dislike the estimated wait time for a…
Review.Contenu: I dislike the estimated wait time for a notary to arrive to the meeting.  I had to wait approximately an hour but the initial estimated wait time was 16 minutes

Review.Titre: Document annotation buggy
Review.Contenu: The document annotation software was very buggy. I would attempt to delete a text box and it wouldn’t delete. Or I would attempt to change tools and it wouldn’t change.

Review.Titre: It would be very helpful when something…
Review.Contenu: It would be very helpful when something is not complete that it takes the notary to the spot that is missing the disclosure or whatever is incomplete.

Review.Titre: too much involved
Review.Contenu: too much involved.  The first person did not wait and cancelled the connection.  The second person was okay and did it by the book.

Review.Titre: I have used it on a NST basis and did 3…
Review.Contenu: I have used it on a NST basis and did 3 test using 3 different people.  All had issues with it and mentioned it’s not user friendly.

Review.Titre: It was ok BUT
Review.Contenu: It was convenient but there were technical problems with 3 people signing the software had issues.

Review.Titre: good service but improper notarization
Review.Contenu: My notary was pleasant, quick, and efficient. However the recipient of the document indicated it had been notarized improperly and rejected the filing. Notarize.com offered a full refund, which I accepted. Three stars due to (1) convenient service, (2) painless refund process, but (3) improper notarization.

Review.Titre: Wasn't able to complete document
Review.Contenu: Wasn't able to complete document.  Then locked out.

Review.Titre: Notary forgot to sign document and we…
Review.Contenu: Notary forgot to sign document and we couldn’t use it.

Review.Titre: It was relatively simple to use but the…
Review.Contenu: It was relatively simple to use but the site was glitchy

Review.Titre: My last notary
Review.Contenu: My last notary, notarized it wrong

Review.Titre: We had app difficulties.
Overall the service is great
Review.Contenu: Overall the service is great, unfortunately not everyone really accept this service as a legit.I had to pay an extra $50 to had that not done electronically.I hope this will not be a problem soon, The notary was good at explaining things and help me with some questions however as I said not everyone except the service at this moment.

Review.Titre: Notarize.com is great BUT...
Review.Contenu: Notarize.com is great but the only issue I have is that I live in NY and most of the things I need notarized need to be signed by a NY notary. It would be nice to be able to pick which state you need your notary to be licensed in. If this is not a requirement for you then notarize.com is all you need.

Review.Titre: Nice UX
Review.Contenu: I found the experience overall to be very straightforward, easy to understand, and more or less frictionless.  Really awesome workflow leveraging a lot of good solutions (QR code to capture images on mobile, video chats, saving documents for sharing, etc).  That being said, I wasn't technically able to complete my task since the state I was trying to notarize my document doesn't allow e-signatures.  I think that's probably on me, but some reminder may have been useful.

Review.Titre: Useful, but looks sketchy
Review.Contenu: It looks questionable when someone looks like they are sitting in a corner of a room and I'm about to hand over personally identifiable data. It was convenient to have a notary on the spot, but having something in the background behind the staff member or something like a notarize logo in the screen would have made me feel much safer than this situation offered.

Review.Titre: Quick & easy but $$$$$
Review.Contenu: Service was quick and easy during weekday, daytime hours. I could not get a connection around 10pm EST on a week night. The representative was friendly and the process was very efficient (under 15 min). I had a bit of sticker shock, however. At $25, the cost is pretty steep (vs.we paid $5 at a local notary for the same service a few days earlier - then needed this one more sheet done), and we didn't see any info on their fees ahead of making the connection with the notary official. So, there is a premium for the convenience.

Review.Titre: The notary was in a very dim room and I…
Review.Contenu: The notary was in a very dim room and I could hardly see him. He told me to change my previous business address to my new address which I tried to explain that I was changing addresses. But he said to change it. He filled in boxes 12,13, and 14 for me but didn't ask any questions about them. Lastly He didn't put my ID's number information down only what ID's I used. I had to provide a screen shot to IPostal due to the fact that they couldn't read my 2nd ID to add the numbers and expiration dates.

Review.Titre: The instructions are not self…
Review.Contenu: The instructions are not self explanatory.  You should get a middle aged person who has never seed or used the site or service before and have them try to complete the process from start to finish with no help.  I am very computer literate and had challenges.  Once I received the proper instructions it was easy, but I should not have had to ask.  At minimum to a you tube example and and a link.

Review.Titre: The notary was helpful
Review.Contenu: The notary was helpful.  However, my initials ended up in a weird place on the form (down where it said office use only). And my title was typed in twice (but typed over itself so you couldn't read it).  I pointed these out to the notary and they said they would not appear on my copy, that she had fixed those errors. When I received my form they had not been fixed. So my form looked a little sloppy.

Review.Titre: Not done right the first time but was corrected
Review.Contenu: It was a quick service but the first notary person did not write it correctly on the wine so I had to pay for the mistake even though it wasn’t my fault. They only refunded me half of the amount and then I had to get it redone all over again which delayed the time that my document is supposed to get here. The second person was really nice and did it correctly thankfully.

Review.Titre: The Notary was outstanding
Review.Contenu: The Notary was outstanding, but the interface is a mess.  It wouldn't work using my iMac desktop nor on my Android phone.  It wouldn't work on any other browser besides Chrome which is the least secure major browser out there, had to reactive mine.  Didn't work on Firefox or Safari.Ended up having to borrow my wife's iPhone - this made for four complete attempts on other devices and/or browsers that were futile.You guys need a new IT Mgr.

Review.Titre: Took six times to get it done each time…
Review.Contenu: Took six times to get it done each time something went wrong they couldn’t hear us had to call us just disappeared on us or the paperwork was too small to read but we did finally get it done took about 45 minutes different person from a different state each time a lot of online problems but if you’re in a pinch and need to get it done at 9 o’clock at night They can make it happen

Review.Titre: Weird situation where the Notary
Review.Contenu: Weird situation where the Notary, in the middle of the call, had a domestic dispute and we heard fighting and arguing, before the call was abruptly ended before it's conclusion.The second person we were connected to was good but we had to enter all of our info again.

Review.Titre: Notarize proved to be a handy tool
Review.Contenu: Notarize proved to be a handy tool. It was a tad expensive, and the web page required scrolling that wasn't obvious at first. The notary was as careful as any I have ever used in person in verifying identity. It would have been good to know ahead of time that not only was an official id needed, but also good images of it for uploading.

Review.Titre: There were several technical issues…
Review.Contenu: There were several technical issues trying to use this platform—which made this not only “not easy” but also frustrating. I was also assigned to a Notary who decided to deviate from the company’s published requirements asking for additional identification verification beyond what the process typically requires and who then disconnected the call abruptly. After four hours of trying the last Notary I connected with conducted the session professionally and expeditiously.

Review.Titre: I went through 3 representatives online…
Review.Contenu: I went through 3 representatives online before I came across the third who has full knowledge of the inter workings of the system and knew what to do in order to finish my document.  Everyone should be up to speed on the system on how to workout problems when they occur.

Review.Titre: In theory, convenient and pricey
Review.Contenu: In theory, it's convenient and fast if you don't mind paying a premium fee.  The notary was polite.  My complaints are that it takes a bit of time to upload your photos and then, on 3 occasions, the system told me no notary was available - without saying when one would be available. I waited about 10 minutes and disconnected. Frustrating.  On the 4th try, the Notarize system told me that no notary was available and I got distracted and - in about 10 minutes - I hear a notary asking 'Hello... anyone there?"

Review.Titre: Fairly Good System
Review.Contenu: Some of the instructions are a little troublesome and not as clear as they could be. In general, the system is fairly good. I did have trouble connecting with the Notary even though my PC pasted the testing before trying to connect. I could hear and see her, but she could not hear me. I had to close and start all over again, which was a hassle and time consuming, but worked.

Review.Titre: Not good service, too much time and money invested.
Review.Contenu: The first two connections were really bad. Your technical support staff were a failure. The third time the notary was nice and calm but she didn’t notarized properly my documents. Therefore we won’t a 4ths time we’re things were done well. It took my 4 attempts, too much time and money invested. I don’t think that is good service.

Review.Titre: Wonderful Service with Security Concerns
Review.Contenu: The service provided makes life so much easier, however, it seems there might be some technical issues. My wife and I both have an account but when used from the same laptop, the app confused us. Her information was in my account and my information was in her account. The biggest red flag is when a different person’s drivers license was saved onto her account. It wasn’t even hers. Even now, this email was addressed to my wife, but sent to me. Please look into the security of this app because now I’m concerned my ID could populate onto someone else’s profile.

Review.Titre: Used two different notaries and both…
Review.Contenu: Used two different notaries and both told me different things about state and city of what I should put in the blanks versus where they were notarizing my signature.  I could not use the printed notarized name for myself.  My document was rejected by the agency requesting a notarized document.

Review.Titre: The ID verification process is…
Review.Contenu: The ID verification process is ridiculous. It is not able to verify a clear picture of your ID when taken on the phone camera, so finally, it accepts your blurry picture taken using your laptop's camera. This is after many failed attempts. I spoke with two different notaries and one of them, a woman was very helpful and sympathetic to my frustrations; the other notary, a man, was blunt and not very helpful.

Review.Titre: Not as User Friendly as you would like
Review.Contenu: It was nice that I could get my document notarized without going outside of my home, but it was not by any stretch of the imagination a user friendly system.  I am a retired computer programmer and I felt that it is not a system that is completely independent of assistance.  You had to read between the lines to figure out each step since a lot of the instructions was not laid out on the screen for you.

Review.Titre: pl add to your notarize team
Review.Contenu: pl add to your notarize team, someone that can read and understand HEBREW.It took me few times to video with notarize that could help, and it was very frustrating to speak all time with Ipostal1 and Notarize support that will try to help me and give me a solution.

Review.Titre: The young women never smiled once
Review.Contenu: The young women never smiled once.  It seemed she was not very happy with her job.  She spoke too fast and was hard to understand.  When I asked her to slow down, she acted as if I was dumb.  She did know her job and completed it well.  The experience was easy flowing and easy to follow.  Notarize as a platform was very well written.  Thank you

Review.Titre: The site says 24/7 service
Review.Contenu: The site says 24/7 service, but if you try to get something done after midnight eastern, no notaries are available. They don't tell you this, until you've spent time uploading and photographing everything... So you have to come back during traditional business hours and start all over. They don't save your uploads.

Review.Titre: It took a few tries for it to actually…
Review.Contenu: It took a few tries for it to actually work. I spoke to two people as the first one had to end the session when we were just about finished. So I had to wait another 20 mins for another person. Overall I spent a over an hour getting the entire process done.

Review.Titre: I thought my documents were properly…
Review.Contenu: I thought my documents were properly notarized but after 1 week and still no word from the mail box service that requested the documents I called and had to forward them myself at which time we discovered one of the documents was completely blank. I had to resubmit brand new documents and start the process all over again so definitely not recommending your service to anyone and wish I could change the notary’s rating at this point.

Review.Titre: To expensive
Review.Contenu: To expensive, otherwise great service. I could of had this notarized in person in town for $5, maybe another $1 to mail it out and have to wait a few extra days for the end point to receive it. You charge $35, that's a 700% increase in price ....

Review.Titre: Easy, But Not Without Issue
Review.Contenu: The service was fast and easy, but not sure that it's going to work for everyone. The notary I was matched with was based in Texas, and the laws on online notarization in Massachusetts require both the signee and the notary to be based in MA to allow the electronic notarization, so I think that's an imperfection in the service, as you can't specifically request a notary from your state.

Review.Titre: After 2 failed but 3rd time was perfect
Review.Contenu: After 2 failed attempts due to the system dropping the first notary before we finished. Then the system told the notary that i had dropped while we were still talking.  The 3rd notary knew the programs and spotted a few mistakes that I had made  in my forms, that the first two had missed.My forms we’re both downloaded and sent automatically to the company that had requested them. Which is a good feature .I dropped 2 stars on the rating,  for the 2 failed attempts and the documents verification process that had to be done several time over, because the system dropped me after verification.

Review.Titre: Docs not submitted by Notaize
Review.Contenu: Anytime Mailbox says that when using this service (Option 2) the notarized document and supporting documents will be sent directly to them.  This does not happen.  I had to submit the notarized form myself plus scan and upload the supporting (IDs) myself after several days of waiting for approval and being told they were still waiting.The notarization process was fine, but you only get a copy that you have to submit yourself.

Review.Titre: This is a very convenient service
Review.Contenu: This is a very convenient service, especially when there is a time crunch to get something notarized.It took over an hour but we were eventually able to get our signature notarized on the AZ Title to our vehicle.  I believe there could have been some instruction provided for completing the form that would have made it easier with the notary that.  In fact, we relied on the notary for instruction!Now I hope it will be accepted.

Review.Titre: The first notary said I had to call…
Review.Contenu: The first notary said I had to call back to complete my form.  I chatted with customer care and they told me the form could have been completed during the session with the instructions of the notary.  Customer care was amazing and sent me another link with another notary.The second notary didn’t have the most pleasant attitude, barely said anything, didn’t instruct me of anything except I only needed to sign and that was it.  When I reviewed the document the notary had completed it but not as I wanted it completed.  There was no interaction and I felt like she had no time but for a signature. Not a good experience

Review.Titre: The first time I tried to use Notarize…
Review.Contenu: The first time I tried to use Notarize now there were problems with the audio. I could hear the employee, but she couldn't hear me. We tried different things and then the employee ended our connection without any warning to me. She knew I could hear her, so why didn't she tell me she would be ending our session and I should try again? It was incredibly rude and unprofessional for her to cut me off without warning.The second time I tried it with a different employee, everything went fine.

Review.Titre: Good in theory, but not so much in practice
Review.Contenu: Once we finally managed to upload all our documents, it was ok. But the system is very limited and didn't accept the documents we had several times. Also, we had one notary go through the entire process once and then the meeting crashed and we lost the whole thing. The second time, after having to reupload all the documents again, that second notary, refused to notarize our document, even though it was exactly the same as the one before, who had accepted our proofs of ID. We finally managed to do it the 4th or 5th time, but we had to wait ages to get in a meeting, even though it kept saying "waiting time, 8 minutes".

Review.Titre: No standardize process between…
Review.Contenu: No standardize process between agents...dealt with two saying rwo different things...Exp:One said the signs Spousal Waiver Form was okay to be signed...second agent was neither very professional in his demeanor and said it needed to be blank....

Review.Titre: The notary i used was very nice and i…
Review.Contenu: The notary i used was very nice and i thought he knew what he was talking about but i just found out the form i did got rejected because of the 2 things he said and did. So now i have to redo the form and occur another charge for a notary. So i do not like the notary service

Review.Titre: The reason why I gave a three on the…
Review.Contenu: The reason why I gave a three on the starrs is because when I was trying to explain the situation the guy thought I was arguing. I don't understand when you are speaking with a guy with va deep voice he's always arguing in their eyes on an explanation. If he had any thought of an argument why continue

Review.Titre: the way she explained my next steps…
Review.Contenu: the way she explained my next steps were extremely unclear. you can watch the recording to see what I mean. all she had to say was "now you will sign in section 5" but instead she said "you should see a 5 or a 15 on your screen, which one do you see? it doesn't matter which." That makes zero sense. I thought maybe she was talking about some type of number would be "popping up" on my screen for security or... I have zero clue what she was referring to.

Review.Titre: The notary was very nice and helpful but...
Review.Contenu: The notary was very nice and helpful but for one problem:I mentioned to him that I didn't think my drivers license picture was done correctly. He said it was no problem and my DL wouldn't be used because I also took a picture of my passport.This turned out to be a hassle and with a few emails back and forth with the vendor I finally got my drivers license picture to them so it could complete the transaction.It created more work that didn't need to be done. (it was my fault originally for not doing the DL picture correctly....but)

Review.Titre: The notaries that I worked with were…Chelsea and Martin.
Review.Contenu: The notaries that I worked with were really good (Chelsea and Martin).  The remote support rep followed up on the technical issue that I had, but did not know her stuff and suggested that I put Notarize on my mobile phone, which was not necessary to resolve the technical problem that I had.

Review.Titre: Good experience but for the…
Review.Contenu: Good experience but for the verification section. There are sections that the eye can miss and the light colored online form would benefit from a red "Required" highlight if a field has not been filled in. The "Oops, we couldn't find enough information about you," doesn't tell you what field you didn't complete.There also needs to be an easy on website in dashboard way to delete your account completely in the event you could not use the service nor receive help from customer service.

Review.Titre: Options for more than two signers are…
Review.Contenu: Options for more than two signers are needed. Having two signers is excellent; however, there are documents where more signatures are required. You can always upsell additional signatures/seals. Please make changes to accommodate such needs.

Review.Titre: 3 attempts to notarize a document
Review.Contenu: 3 attempts to notarize a document first the notary had a technical issuethen the secind could not use the document that the first notary had leftso i had to start from scratch the document on the third attempt which was successful a lot of time wasted

Review.Titre: When I finally got it to work it was…
Review.Contenu: When I finally got it to work it was fine and the notary was great but it took about a week and 5 or 6 different submitting of the document from the other company to notarize before it worked for me. I'm not sure on whose end the issue was but it was frustrating

Review.Titre: The process was bit constraining…
Review.Contenu: The process was bit constraining because I needed technical assistance from my husband, but the notary told us he couldn't talk at all or it would invalidate the notarization.  We got it done - without having to physically going to a notary - but it was more stressful than anticipated.

Review.Titre: The first male rep was rude and dropped…
Review.Contenu: The first male rep was rude and dropped the call because I was working in my business and a customer approached me asking for something; the second male rep was unprofessional, and finally a woman took care of business! Five stars for Kerrian!

Review.Titre: I love Notarize.com -- when it works
Review.Contenu: I love Notarize.com -- when it works.  Half the time my attempt is rejected either for trivial reasons (the document was submitted as two pdf files instead of one, e.g.) or for reasons that had not been explained in advance (can't notarize a document for a Canadian court). This is an awful waste of my time and, usually, the notary's time too.  Because the process of being identified is so onerous, even the prospect of rejection is very off-putting.  What is desperately needed is an automatic way of checking a submission without entirely invalidating it if there is something wrong.

Review.Titre: 5 stars for notary but 2 stars for ID verification
Review.Contenu: The notary was helpful and efficient but the automated ID verification process was pretty frustrating. After accidentally submitting a blurry photo on my first attempt, I was prompted to resubmit that photo but then the submission page crashed again...and again...and again. Switched to a different browser on my phone, same issue. Finally switched to my laptop and was able to complete the process there, thus ending ten minutes of swearing and yelling at screens. It would have been nice to be given a chance to verify ID with the notary during the video call after the second or third failed attempt, but I didn't see that option.

Review.Titre: It was a great experience
Only complaint is that the audio on the…
Review.Contenu: Only complaint is that the audio on the call/chat was quite poor.

Review.Titre: Saves Time
Review.Contenu: The best thing about Notarize.com is that it saves a trip to a physical location.  Documents were reviewed ahead of time and a time was scheduled to virtually sign with a notary online.  We had some issues with our browser connecting to the camera, but I used their Chat text function to seek assistance and we got it figured out.  The only gripe we had was that when we went through all the steps and were ready to connect with a notary we got a message that the next available would be 40 minutes, but 3-5 minutes later we were talking to a notary and finishing our process.  Not sure why we got that message, but it was going to make us really upset.

Review.Titre: Devon saved the experience for me
Review.Contenu: Devon saved the experience for me.  I was having some technical difficulties with the camera on my laptop.  I attempted a live chat and the individual was of very little help, giving me advice as though I should know what she was talking about.  I really wanted to say "speak to me like I have never used a computer before."  I discontinued the chat because it wasn't helpful.After that was resolved, I had technical difficulties with the audio on my computer.  Devon helped me through that process and we were able to complete it.  He was absolutely superb.  I think it might be worth encouraging technical help to speak to people in simpler language, easily understood by all and not simply a tech savvy clientele.

Review.Titre: We got the job done quickly
Review.Contenu: Notary was helpful and seemed knowledgeable-it felt a bit rushed for me but I think that was because of the nature of my document.  But he did a good job of explaining different terms.  I also was confused when I was suposed to pay, because he did not say--it is at the end after you sign your document and are off the call, by the way. Overall this was a great experience and I would use it again. Good price, fast, got the document right away.

Review.Titre: Log in functionality issues but great team members
Review.Contenu: The log in process wouldn’t access my camera and even after your team contacted me I wound up having to download the app to get it working.  Your team was helpful, pleasant, and efficient which is why I still gave a high score.  The website functionality could have resulted in a lower score.  Kudos to your team members.

Review.Titre: Night time need more waiting
Review.Contenu: If you are calling a meeting with notaries during the night time of ETU, prepare to wait for a long time, quite  a bit more than the the waiting period that your screen shows.Apart from above, all good.

Review.Titre: This was an extremely easy process and…
Review.Contenu: This was an extremely easy process and I recommend it to everyone.  My only drawback is the form that is signed comes out looking like a scan and I have had a couple of agencies not accept the form as it appeared to be a scan so I had to physically go to a notary and get it done again.  If there is a way they can send the signed paperwork not looking like a scan, this would be 5 stars.

Review.Titre: Very easy and convenient!
Review.Contenu: The actual process of closing was excellent - very easy and convenient.  The only reason that I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is that it was a bit confusing to navigate when we tried to review the forms in advance.  We also ended up having to do the ID verification twice because it was not clear that we could not do that in advance either.  But overall good experience and saved us a lot of hassle.

Review.Titre: My time with the notary was great
Review.Contenu: My time with the notary was great; everything explained clearly and the signing process went smoothly.  The one suggestion I have is to allow uploading of existing photos for IDs.  I have an older phone and it is difficult for me to get a clear photo of an ID, so I have an existing photo stored for this purpose.  But the system made me take new photos, and this took an extra 20 minutes before it worked.

Review.Titre: Notary was great and easy to work with
Review.Contenu: Notary was great and easy to work with.  Only issue I had was verifying identity with camera taking picture of ID.  System would not focus and so ID would constantly take a blurry picture of ID that would not work on verification.  It became very frustrating.  Need better work there.

Review.Titre: A great option that will likely go flawlessly for most
Review.Contenu: It was very nice to be able to do this from out-of-state/anywhere. The third notary we got was the charm and he was great!! However, we had to acquire additional information that we did not have and that required us to log back in after speaking with the first notary. When we logged back in and were set up with notary #2, he told us he was from Virginia and that a note on our title specifically said no Virginia notary allowed. Instead of just being transferred to the third notary, we had to go all the way back into the system and fill out all the information and security questions for a third time. That was kind of annoying.

Review.Titre: Application is easy to use
Review.Contenu: Application is easy to use and I like that you can actually see and speak with a notary person. Getting photo ID to work was a bit of a challenge as I wasn't able to get my FL Real ID Drivers License to be verified as the photos on the license are blurry to begin with. I used my US Passport instead for ID verification.

Review.Titre: Mostly good experience
Review.Contenu: Mostly, i had a great experience. The step to take a photo of my ID was glitchy- i had to begin again several times, but besides that, it was smooth.

Review.Titre: Overall good experience
Review.Contenu: Great notary, she was very friendly and knowledgeable. Just took a long time to get through everything, because of all the statements and disclosures the notary was required to put on after each notarization.

Review.Titre: It was completed in one call
Review.Contenu: It was completed in one call. The notary didn’t make it clear that he was in control of submission of each form, it confused me because I kept trying to scroll through all the forms.

Review.Titre: Joyce and Allen were *excellent*
Review.Contenu: Joyce and Allen were *excellent*Pre-video call directions were non-existent and created a bit of panic at the beginning. That is the only thing I would change.

Review.Titre: Very convenient for most users
Review.Contenu: The system worked well for the tech savvy among us but elderly users will likely need further assistance or easier options.

Review.Titre: Site was in German, but everything else was great
Review.Contenu: Our notary was great. The only problem was that the website was in German. Luckily my husband speaks German, so we were able to upload our drivers licenses, but it would be a problem for anyone else.

Review.Titre: Very easy process
Review.Contenu: Very easy process. The ID upload was the most frustrating part because pictures kept coming in as blurry to the notary although they were clear on my end.

Review.Titre: The software was a bit clunky...
Review.Contenu: The software was a bit clunky and did not run as smoothly as I expected.  I had to re-enter numerous items and actually had to send a photo of my ID via email to the title company because the software did not process or accept it within the tool.

Review.Titre: Patience and Humor made it work
Review.Contenu: The ladies were new to the Notarize platform and struggled to make it work well. We hung in there together with them and got it done! They were super sweet and made the process enjoyable! We loved our experience with Highland Homes and all the partners that make it work!

Review.Titre: Everything was super clear and smooth…
Review.Contenu: Everything was super clear and smooth during the live video chat. Only complaint is that the notary stamp/seal was really small. Also the Tax Assessor Office in Dallas had never seen an online notary seal and were skeptical BUT they let it through thank God. My son and I needed some documents notarized to transfer him the title of a car. He was only in town on Sunday. This turned out to work great - thanks!

Review.Titre: Great Convenience with This Platform
Review.Contenu: This platform made it very easy to sign all of my closing paperwork electronically.  I appreciate the opportunity to review all of the documents in advance, and it worked well when I was on with the title company representative.  My only recommendations would be to make it clearer re. how to log in (via a specific link) and to clarify which forms can be signed in advance and which need to be signed in the presence of the Notary.

Review.Titre: This is a VERY convenient service
Review.Contenu: This is a VERY convenient service. Well, my first time was not successful due to an issue on my side, so I had to re-try again. The second time though took me on a little bit another flow: it redirected me to my phone for snapping my IDs. I was a confused, because the first time I did it on my laptop. The whole experience was positive, quick and effective.

Review.Titre: It went very well, however…
Review.Contenu: It went very well, however session was canceled few times due to long time to wait for notary. So finally after 3rd or 4th time with time slot adjustment I was able to get connected with the notary. Except then that all went very well.

Review.Titre: the notary at my bank does it for free
Review.Contenu: They even print it out for me, ensures all information is correct before signing, and even sends me a digital copy.***Make your 3rd party services clear*** and what you are and are not responsible for. Wasted a year on trying to resolve the issue between the company requiring a notarized document and Notarize. Very annoying. Enjoy my $20, you'll never see another penny from me, maybe unless it's between that and dying.4 stars: only because this process made me appreciate my bank notary so much more, and I get to minimize fueling big companies.

Review.Titre: The people were great
Review.Contenu: The people were great.  The connecting was terrible.  Both time my brother and I had to use it, it took an hour to solve various technical difficulties, despite the help desk.  What should’ve taken 15 minutes and 5 minutes, took 90 minutes and an hour, respectively.

Review.Titre: Once I got my camera and microphone…
Review.Contenu: Once I got my camera and microphone working it was good. I got a quick call back. The agent was polite and efficient. You get your documents notarized and emailed back.

Review.Titre: Easy and Effective
Review.Contenu: Easy and EffectiveThe process was fast and effective.  It was just as fast as in person notary.  The only somewhat awkward portion is that the signer has to sign their name on a piece of white paper and then scan that into the program with a camera.  However, it technically worked fine and the service worked as advertised.

Review.Titre: File downloading and usability
Review.Contenu: Love this service!  its quite difficult downloading the executed file. Having it download as a zip makes it more difficult file to work with immediate. Advise giving the user of the option of not zipping the file.

Review.Titre: Notarized Document
Review.Contenu: Easy site to access. I had a hard time taking my ID picture, it was to light. Gentlemen notary was so nice and patient. Advised me to step away and find another  spot to take ID picture.  It worked!!!

Review.Titre: The people were great
Review.Contenu: The people were great, I wish there was a way to swap the first and second signers without starting over, that caused some confusion.

Review.Titre: Wonderful concept & product
Review.Contenu: Wonderful concept & product, just had a bit of trouble with camera and microphone initially but it was ironed out. All was well thereafter

Review.Titre: Fine Service, Set-up Could Be Easier
Review.Contenu: The service itself worked great and the Notary was both helpful and friendly. The only problem I had was getting the camera and microphone to work. I was using a Mac and Safari. After clearing the cache and history from the browser, it went fine.

Review.Titre: The notary was great and the process…
Review.Contenu: The notary was great and the process went smoothly except for sign in.  I was late for the meeting because I didn't realize I wasn't logged in until after reading over all the documents.

Review.Titre: Fast, Easy, Contradictory Info From Different Employees
Review.Contenu: Both of the ladies that I spoke with were nice, but they gave me contradictory information.  The first one said I needed more identification, so I waited an entire month for my new passport to arrive.  A month later, when my passport arrived, the second lady said I never needed it.  Now I have to wait a few days to see if the first lady was wrong or the second lady.  Either way, one of the ladies really screwed me over.  Not cool.  Otherwise, it's a fast easy process.

Review.Titre: I found the service mostly easy to use
Review.Contenu: I found the service mostly easy to use.  The technology to cover all the bases needed for a complete notary process was very good.  It did take time to complete what was required but it was more efficient than seeking out my Bank's Notary person.

Review.Titre: Notary was friendly
Review.Contenu: Notary was friendly. Made interview quick and easy.Had problem getting a Notary to speak to. Tried several times with long waits and no one to speak with.

Review.Titre: Don't use a smartphone! Only Lap top or desk top comp.
Review.Contenu: Was a quick process after I got on my lap top. I had tried to use my smartphone for 45 min. and it kept freezing at a certain point. You can't use a smartphone even though it says you can. So that was very frustrating and wasted so much time. If I had known from the beginning I would have started on my laptop and been done in 20 mins. Instead of almost an hour and a half later.

Review.Titre: Highly Recommend!
Review.Contenu: Actually everything was great except the downloading process wasn't seamless - but -that could have been me. I would give a 4.8 ! My notary was stellar!!

Review.Titre: The digital verification was easy for…
Review.Contenu: The digital verification was easy for me, but my wife had 6 failed attempts (software analysis was buggy) and it was frustrating. Once we made it to the video portion it was super easy.

Review.Titre: The whole experience was good one
Review.Contenu: The whole experience was good one.  The only feedback that I can give is that some of the information given was confusing to work through.  It was given to me very quickly and I was trying to understand it all so quickly.  Other than that the experience was pleasant and would definitely use the Notarize now application again.

Review.Titre: Service was fine but filling out the…
Review.Contenu: Service was fine but filling out the forms was confusing; My wife needed to sign a document and it took 2 tries to figure out what to do, probably due to my age.

Review.Titre: I logged on with my computer checked…
Review.Contenu: I logged on with my computer checked the video and sound, but had to use my smartphone to take pictures of my drivers license and passport. I was hoping to not have to use my smartphone. Overall I got it done other than what I noted above great processing.

Review.Titre: Service worked well.
Review.Contenu: Service worked well.However, cost should have been disclosed prior to document signing. I paid 25.00 for a 3 page document. I would be happy to use services again if cost was a bit more affordable.
